name: unscalable
content:
unscalable adjective
(CANNOT BE CLIMBED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be climbed: The tower was unscalable from the outside. The inner security zone was surrounded by a 3-metre-high unscalable fence. They were trapped in an alley with unscaleable walls. Related word
scale verb (CLIMB)
More examplesFewer examplesThe wall was high, but it was hardly unscalable.

unscalable adjective
(CANNOT BE DEALT WITH)
not able to be successfully dealt with or controlled: Their one-nil lead suddenly looked like an unscalable barrier. The political hurdles look unscalable. Synonym
insurmountable

unscalable adjective
(CANNOT BE INCREASED)
not able to be made larger in size, amount, or importance: Developers must assess the feasibility of using potentially unscalable technologies. Renewable energy at that time was said to be too uncertain and too unscalable. Opposite
scalableRelated word
scale something up
